entry.title: newsletter number 69
entry.content:
Hello Folks! It’s #TechThursday at #namshi!

News from the tech team:

We’re super excited to have Mohamed Amin ( our new front end developer ) in Namshi family.

The tech team was learning #PhpSpec from Daniel

Here is the list with awesome links our team been looking at over past week:

  • Whaat’s going on with io.js

  • State of RocksDB – RocksDB Meetup

  • Clean code linters

  • Profiling with blackfire

  • What are some biggest red flags during an interview?

  • Symfony2 @ Namshi

  • JavaScript application architecture

  • Logging with logstash at clay.io

  • Beautiful static documentation for your API with Slate

  • PHP At 5000 Requests Per Second: Hootsuiteâ€™s Scaling Story

  • The Art of Programming – By Erika Heidi

  • Bolt 2.0 released – New major version release of the Simple & Sophisticated CMS based on Silex, Symfony and modern technologies.

  • phpBB.com Hacked!

  • Stop Telling Me To Refactor

  • The Design of LLVM

  • Programming Language Implementation

  • Mark DiMarco: User Interface Algorithms JSConf2014

  • CodePen’s CSS

  • Exposing A Service Directly On The $scope In AngularJS

  • 5 things you should know about DDoS attacks, outages, SSL, and web performance

  • Research: Performance Impact of Popular JavaScript MVC Frameworks

  • Use ELK to visualise security data

  • Big data in minutes with the ELK Stack

  • How to Perform Fuzzy-Matching with Mongo Connector and Elastic Search

  • Provisioning Consul with Puppet

  • Generation of diagram and flowchart from text in a similar manner as markdown

  • Kappa is a command line tool that makes it easier to deploy, update, and test functions for AWS Lambda.

  • Hystrix: Latency and Fault Tolerance for Distributed Systems

  • Docker on the Mac (without boot2docker)

  • Asynchronous templates for the browser and node.js

  • Rest.li is a REST+JSON framework for building robust, scalable service architectures using dynamic discovery and simple asynchronous APIs.

  • When your IP traffic in AWS disappears into a black hole

  • Flash-optimized in-memory open source NoSQL database

  • Simple, high-reliability, distributed software configuration management

  • Develop, deploy, and maintain your application anywhere. Use one console and one workflow from development to production

  • EC2 Container Service In Action

  • Deploying Dockerized Applications with Salt
